name: Terraform Definitions
description: Repository containing Terraform code for managing cloud resources for all managed Amazon and Azure accounts at Salsify. Includes modules for AWS/Azure infrastructure, microservices, data pipelines, and SXM (SupplierXM) environments. Organized into accounts/ (cloud account-level config), environments/ (Infrastructure Management Platform environments), services/ (service instance resources), and modules/ (reusable golden path configurations).

name: Infrastructure Management Platform
description: Salsify's internal platform for managing infrastructure environments and services. Referenced in the terraform repository where environments/ directories map to IMP environments and services/ directories contain IMP service definitions with their cloud resources.

name: terraform-production CLI
description: Command-line tool for running Terraform commands with the appropriate environment configuration and provider tokens. Located in tools/terraform-production within the terraform repository. Commonly symlinked to ~/.local/bin/tprod for easier access.

name: Supply Experience Management (Terraform)
description: In the terraform context, SXM refers to Azure-based infrastructure modules for SupplierXM environments. Includes modules like sxm-asg (auto-scaling groups), sxm-lb (load balancers), sxm-vm (virtual machines), sxm-vnet (virtual networks), sxm-redis, sxm-environment, and sxm-storage. SXM environments include sxm-dev, sxm-int, sxm-ltg, sxm-meta, sxm-ppr, and sxm-prd.

name: Hosting Platform
description: Salsify's infrastructure team responsible for managing cloud infrastructure. Owns default PagerDuty services for microservice alerts ('Hosting Platform Production Infrastructure - Alerts' and 'Hosting Platform Production Infrastructure - Warnings'). Teams can configure their own PagerDuty services or route alerts to Hosting Platform's services.

name: Alkemics Environment
description: Environment variable (alk_env) used in SXM terraform modules to configure Alkemics-related infrastructure in Azure environments. Alkemics was acquired by Salsify and its infrastructure is managed through terraform SXM modules including alk-services application security groups.
